data.name: labelKeyboardInstructions.Text
data.value:
Press the arrow keys to move around the grid.
Press Space to turn up a square.
Press Enter to turn two mismatched upturned squares back down.
Press F1 to show this Help window.
Press F2 to show the Settings window, where you can specify which pictures are to be shown on the upturned cards, and whether sounds are to be played when a pair of cards is turned up.
Press F5 to restart a game.

data.name: labelScreenReaderNotes.Text
data.value: When a screen reader moves to a square in the grid, it announces that the square is a button. For example, when moving to square number 13, it might announce: "Card 13, Face down button", along with row and column related details.

data.name: labelGoal.Text
data.value: When the game is run, a 4x4 grid of blank squares appears. When a square is clicked, an image is shown on the square. When another square is then clicked, an image is also shown on that second square. If the two images are the same, then the squares are considered to be matched, and will not change again for the rest of the game. If the images do not match, then the squares are considered to be unmatched, and the squares must be turned back over. These steps are then repeated until all matching images have been found.
